intro: Psychotria hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria hirsutissima is often found in understory habitats of rainforests and is known for its ecological importance to local wildlife.
